string.text: Hello, Stalker!
Am I seeing things?
Hi.
You're fine. Help me, please, uncle... I - I'm not just a toy, I'm an assistant, I'm helping someone. I have to find him. It's uncle Kolya, he's somewhere in the Zone. Please...
I get it, it's a robot! Interesting contraption.
Who is he?
I knew I'd find someone, hurray! Look, are you a good guy or a bad guy? If you're bad, throw me back, and if you're good, help me. Will you help me?
I'll help. What should I do?
Please, do not throw me away! I'll die here, if no one helps me, and along with me, my friend who needs help!
Madness.

Uncle Kolya, afraid he would be robbed, hid me there 6 months ago and went away on business. And then disappeared. More recently, I got slung into the anomaly where you found me during a blowout. We need to find Kolya, I have to know what happened to him. We'll have to follow in his footsteps, and for that I can show you the way.
How will you do that?
I can recognize places, I feel them. When we get close to the place, I'll give you a signal. So what do you think? Will you help me, kind Stalker?
Good.

Thank you, you really are a good guy! Do you know what we should do? We have to go to a Stalker called Tail and ask him about Kolya. If you wonder why we should go see him first, it's because he's Kolya's friend. I've updated your PDA so that it now shows roughly where we may find Tail.
Well, that's a lead.
Hi master, what did you want?
What are you doing here? Who are you?
Remind me, what should I do?
Do you know something interesting?
I have a problem with your request.
Don't you have to eat?

I don't know who or what I am. But since I'm aware of myself I must be someone, not something. I don't remember where I come from, but I do remember something: the place I appeared is called "Hospital". Someone must have made a strong wish for me to appear. My friend went there and made a very, very strong wish and then I appeared. One day my friend fell asleep and someone all big and grown-up came and took me with him. It was Nikolai - Uncle Kolya. He came to this area and hid me there.
Here's how.
We should go to the bar and talk to the Stalker named Tail. He'll tell us about Kolya and it will be easier to find him.
Tail said Kolya went to a place called City-32. Let's look for this place.
Got it.
I can provide advice, I can tell a story, I can even come up with something myself.
Where did you learn all that?
I've laid in the Zone a long time and read the thoughts of Stalkers passing by. What do you say?
I've laid in the Zone a long time and read the thoughts of Stalkers passing by. Maybe you need advice?
I've laid in the Zone a long time and read the thoughts of Stalkers passing by. Oh, I wish I had something interesting to tell you, but... I've forgotten. I'll remember it in five minutes.
Well, remember.
Give advice.
Tell a story.
How long till the next blowout?
Where can I find a good artifact?
I don't need anything for now.
Thanks for the advice.

If you meet an enemy in the Zone, do not rush to shoot - first make sure that it really is your enemy. Some mercenaries, soldiers, or even bandits will sometimes make peace with loners if they need help.

Sometimes in the Zone you'll find old safes, locked with combination locks. It is not always possible to break them open or hack them, but if you do you'll often find interesting stuff. If you encounter such a safe, remember the following.
1) Their code consists of no more than 4 or 6 digits.
2) The numbers on the wheel - it's the regular numbers from 0 to 9.
3)Use logical clues to figure out the code.

Some artifacts do not have properties, either positive or negative. However, many of them are still of very high interest to scientists, so do not rush to sell such "useless" looking artifacts: maybe someone else will pay a lot more for them.

Some artifacts are invisible to the naked eye. You have to extract them using those gizmos - I forget what they're called. They're peculiar in the sense that they are created only in certain places and at varying intervals.

Sometimes, instead of valuable loot you might find a book or manuscript. I advise you to think twice before throwing it away or selling it. Even if it sounds ridiculous, you may find some to whom these things are useful among the Stalkers. They may not mind sharing valuable stuff in return, such as interesting intel.
I feel something is very wrong.
Oh, I wish I had something interesting to tell you, but... I've forgotten. I'll remember it in five minutes.
Good.
[...go ahead...]
Something made me forget all the stories... Oh, you shouldn't bother.

Once upon a time two Stalkers went to raid for loot together and stumbled upon a very valuable artifact. They immediately rushed to it, bumping their foreheads in their haste! But there was only one artifact and two friends: they needed a solution. They argued again and again, but could not agree. Thought and thought, but to no avail. The first wanted to sell the artifact and split the money, the other wanted to keep such a precious artifact for himself and repay the other with a part of his own loot.

They argued all day until someone came by and advised them to talk to Zacharie the Forester, who lived alone in the Hollow. The old man was known to his fellow Stalkers for his wisdom and the fairness of his decisions. The friends went to him. They explained the reason for their dispute and he answered them: "The Zone made you quarrel, She shall reconcile you. Take this thing that you found and put it on the rotten stump just behind my hut."

"Cover it with the old bucket that is lying there and wait for three hours, then take a look under the bucket. If the artifact turns blue, the first of you shall have it, and if it turns red, the second." The Stalkers went to Zacharie's garden, found the stump and put the artifact on it, covered the artifact with the bucket, and sat to wait. After waiting one hour, then two, then three, our friend's nerves started to surrender to the pull of the half-a-million ruble artifact! The first of them started to grumble at the second...

It went on and on and finally the second snapped and soon there they were, yelling at each other - curses and good old Russian obscenities. They both grabbed their knives, then stopped, waiting to see who would be the first to attack. Suddenly, both noticed that a strange smell was coming from the bucket. One of the former friends cautiously raised its edge and both saw that on the stump, instead of their artifact, there was nothing but an ordinary pile of cow dung. Judging by the smell, it was pretty fresh.

The two Stalkers lost it for a little while until they finally came to their senses, when they immediately rushed to Zacharie. The old man looked at the stump and told them, "It might not be obvious, but that bucket of mine is anomalous. It revealed to you the secret of the artifact! And to think you were ready to get killed for it..." With these words, the Forester spat juicily onto the stump and went into his hut. What happened to our heroes is unknown, but I do know that nobody ever found this artifact again.
Interesting.

Once upon a time an experienced Stalker went looking for loot and didn't return. He was awaited for one day, two, and on the third already he was awaited no more... Suddenly on the fourth day he arrives and tell everyone: "Guys, I found something - is unbelievable. Come with me!" A group of six men gathered, well equipped, armed themselves and went with him. A day passes, two - no sign from them, nor hope. The other Stalkers started scratching their crowns. Those that went weren't born yesterday, something was clearly not right here.

A second group gathered, certainly about a dozen people; Many were armed to the teeth, high-class rounds, detectors, a stalker, he even had a RPG pinned on his back. They went and... Yes, you guessed it - never returned! Their comrades grieved for a long time, even made near the entrance of the bar something akin to a monument for them: a cross with a gasmask and a sign with the names. Made a little party at the 100Rad, as commemoration. Suddenly, the head of the "Duty" became very interested in this matter.

He wanted to know, what kind of power in the Zone had emerged, that almost twenty Stalkers couldn't cope with it. He gathered his best scouts and ordered them to find the missing Stalkers, and if they couldn't, then at least find the cause for their disappearance. These mens were professionals - athletes, commando, ninja! Even prior to the Zone they had learned how to survive in the jungle with only a knife at hand.

They weren't afraid of wild beasts nor anomalies, and they could deal bare-handed not only with bandits but also mercenaries. The scouts went on the search and the next day they went to the alleged place, where the missings had last been seen - a small abandoned plant. As they approached they smelled a strange chemical smell... The commander of the scouts, an experienced man, immediately ordered his soldiers to put on their gas masks. As they crept in, they saw the following picture:

In the middle of the main building was a hefty tank. Around it laid the bodies. The scouts counted a total eighteen, none of them moved. Suddenly, from behind a corner jumped out... nah, probably tumbled out a Stalker with a RPG at the ready. Staggering, he blearily studied the entire company for a long time, then finally, and with difficulty said:\nAttention! Your papers! Comrade commander, report: as of eight o'clock in the evening the remainder in the main tank - one hundred and seven liters, no leaks were found... Then he fell down and asleep. Dead drunk.
Thank you for the story.

There was once a Stalker nicknamed "Beetle". He had this nick for, as you guessed, his cunningness and caution. Now then, one day our Beetle went ahead and screwed up. How did he do that? Very simple. He took an order for a rare artifact, but before the client was even informed, he cut to the Bar "100Rad". The client of the Beetle was powerful, beyond the perimeter. "If he's offended, thought Beetle, - better for me not to come back from the Zone!"

He thought and thought and decided to cheat his client. And since he was a cunning Stalker, he decided to do it with his mind. "I will fake to him my own death, -thought our Beetle, and then softly retreat from the Zone. Anyway, I don't personally know the client, so all will be well." But for the accident to seem plausible, witesses were needed. Beetle decided to use for this purpose one of his friends who owed him some money. That friend was called Slavik, and his nickname was Bubble.

Beetle called him along to the "Rostok" factory in front of his careful preparations. They came to a distance of places Stalkers were familiar with, when Beetle, shouting especially loudly and waving his arms, fell, or rather jumped into the prepared and camouflaged pit. At the bottom of the pit laid the fresh corpse of an unlucky Stalker, who Beetle found on the outskirts of the Bar (a bloodsucker killed the poor soul).

The dead man was wearing the exact same suit as our Beetle next to him, had been given the same backpack and automatic, and his face was severely disfigured - everything artfully taken care of by Beetle. He did not foresee one thing though: the night before an hungry snork got in the pit, which the carrion smell atracted. One can only imagine the horror and surprise of poor hapless Bubble, when he saw at the bottom of the pit rather than one two of Beetle, and even an extra Snork.

"Help me! - yelled Beetle in the meantime, lashing out the mutant, just don't shoot, I'll climb! Give me your hand, I'll get out of here!" However, the Bubble does not help someone in a hurry. Having assessed that Beetles chances were rather slim, he turned and walked away, ignoring the cries from the pit. He owed too much to beetle - it played a role. Meanwhile, having the hungry, growling snork, crawling up to him our schemer, who dug the pit himself, found himself in the worst position.

Beetle rose his AK, but it snapped - the fall filled the shutter with dirt. Barely out of the pit, our sly dog, he paid the price for salvation by letting the snork rip up his legs and back. Limping back to the camp, he learned that mercenaries kidnapped the Bubble right out of his tent. Apparently, the client learned Beetle bailed out of his deal and began searching through his teammates. More about the Bubble have not been heard. Beetle is now a carreer Stalker.
Well-well...

Once upon a time a Stalker walked through the Garbage and saw: on the roadside, a sitting Fracture, and in its paw he had an artifact! He made it turn between his claws, and then slipped it into his jacket and - run. The Stalker followied him. He ran behind the escaping, the Fracture, the beast, it turned out clever, going aroung "Springboards", jumping over "Fruit punches", slipping past "Vortexes"! The Stalker ran carefully on his trail. They ran into some grove, the Fracture jumped - and dropped into a burrow under an old stump. The man took his AK and planted the barrel in the hole.

He wanted to throw a grenade, but did not - could have broken the artifact. He shot, sat, unable to catch his breath. But suddenly he hears - from the hole comes a faint voice: "Stalker" - it says, - "do not shoot at me, though I'm a mutant, I desire to live. Let's rather make a deal as such: I give you the artifact, and even show a place where there are a lot of them, and you let me go." The Stalker answered the mutant: -Good! -and to himself thinks "I'll take the artifacts and shoot the monster, though no sufferings." You know a Fracture is best no to turn your back to - strike it dead.

The Fracture got out of the hole, beckoned with its claws, and limped off into the bushes, the Stalker after him. They walked a hundred meters, found a clearing with a large stone in the middle of it. The Fracture crawled to it, dig the earth at the base of it with its paw and pull into the light an old half-rotten backpack and pours directly on the Stalker's feet about twenty quite rare artifacts - more than collected in a week! He dumped his loot in front of him and quietly backed away to get back into the forest. But the man is not born yesterday, he realized what was happening here.

He aims at it and says: -Show the remaining caches, if you don't want me to shorten your tail! The freak hissed, groaned. Obviously, it doesn't want to part with its findings, but the fear is stronger. He led the Stalker throughout the forest, they began to empty caches and transfer their contents into the Stalker's backpack. They stuffed the backpack almost to the top, the Staker had already thrown away his canned food to free place. There the Fracture says: - There's one cache left, the greatest...

The Stalker is delighted and begins to imagine how much to get from his goods and what to buy himself with the money. He estimated that for the dream - the new "Ford" - it should be enough. He began to dream about coming to his native town not in the stinking train, but in a brand new car, calling for himself in the courtyard, honking loudly, as if waiting for someone. The neighbours lean out of the window to watch, and he gets out of the car, stands next to it, light a cigarette, put his hand on the hood... A new suit, shoes, black sunglasses...

The former classmate, Victor-major(?), who laughed when he learned that he got a job as welder at the plant with two diplomas, at least once in their lives broken off. Something that - at his father's two store, the Stalker had not seen even once. Now then, they approach the last place. The Stalker sees: amongst young pines is lying an aircraft fuselage. Big in size, it seems, "Maize". How it got there - it is not known, however, rumors go that there were some extreme athletes who have tried to fly over the Zone in private planes, to take pictures, but got lost.

The fuselage was all mangled, peeled off the tail, the wings broken, the cockpit crushed. The Fracture approached it, opened the door and climbed in, the Stalker having to wait outside. Keeping watch anyway, that the cunning one doesn't run away. Suddenly, from the wreckage comes a loud hiss, and out of it pops a hefty Chimera. The thunderstruck Stalker immediately starts fleeing. He runs into the woods, stumbles, going aroung "Springboards", jumping over "Fruit punches", slipping past "Vortexes"! Barely made it. Forgot to think about the loot, only remembering once he's taken his breath back next to the bar and noticed the backpack is not present.

That's the story... Yeah, that's not all! After a week we heard of a Stalker, with most interesting that he saw the Fracture. He saw it - again sitting, that asshole, at the same old place! The man quietly took his automatic to his shoulder and was about to take aim... The freak felt something, jumped up and ran away. The Stalker shot once - missed. He approached the spot the Fracture was sitting at, and saw a lost backpack. He looks inside - all canned food, threw it in the woods, lying on the ground. More of the Fracture has not been seen.
Yeah...

Once a stranger came to visit the Zone. What he had forgotten in it? It's just what his work was like - to go around the world, to visit the most dangerous places on the planet and then to describe them. He was a journalist and a traveller, and, quite a famous one. He has visited Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya, even the Chechen Republic. He travelled in the wild jungles of Amazon and the african deserts, contacted local hostile tribes, won confidence of these savages, lived among them; described it in books or wrote articles for magazines, such as "National Geographics" or "Science", he even went on TV.

And one beautiful day he decided to visit our Zone and see, the Stalkers living here; what they eat, what they drink, what they do in their spare time, et caetera. Our foreigner was especially interested in the local folklore. He was a big connoisseur of literature, knowing russian well, he read Pushkin, Dostoyevsky and Tolstoy in the original. He decided to collect when possible all histories, jokes, legends, and simple fairy tales connected to the Zone and its inhabitants. However, being an experienced man in such affairs, he made his excursion to the Chernobyl zone a secret.

Understand: Militaries would not allow it - first, bandits would prey on him - second, mercenaries would scam him on the repayment - third. So he acted on it, simply, reasonably, but with one mistake - making the operation undercover. So here arrives the journalist (that was called James) to our country under another name, having declared at home in England, that he'd go to investigate Sahara's bedouins culture and customs. Here we had friends that helped him make a deal for a sortie in the Zone.

They charged him a lot of money for this - and thought he arrived. But the tourist wasn't satisfied with the program of our brave men of Albion, he wanted to dive head first into the atmosphere of danger and risk of a Stalker's life. Our James that didn't go meet African bedouins however soon regretted his decision. All began that at the Perimeter his group was properly shaken by major Ovchinin. I know of this major not from hearsay - he has hardly not beaten me a kidney off on interrogation when I got into a violation of regime at the Cordon.

The veteran warrior started his usual "Shaking" on our gallant traveller and his escort. To those that give all their loot and shut the fuck up - all would go well. Skilled Stalkers for whom it is not the first time going in the Zone, they did as such: take a certain sum (not too much, but not copecks either) and without resistance give it to the major, if it grants them access to the Zone without problems. At the same time they'll earn much more in artifact later, if lucky.

But he was an indignated lionheart, he protested, appealed to fairness, a military honor, then recalled the European Court of Human Rights... Basically, when "Sonnie" major had finished with the then brave, he hardly had enough forces, to limp to the camp. Our journalist, he rested a bit in bed there to recover. There our veterans tried means to heal him, but have only made it worse - made the foreigner eat things, and he was even worse from it, than from the beating... Cordon's sludge - such a thing: one from it will go well, and others will suffer, I know it myself.

And so, as our englishman came back up on his legs, he wanted to reach the Bar as he knew from stories, that there most Stalkers live. Locals decided to accompany. But in kilometers from the camp they were "received" by bandits. Turns out someone amongst our guys is a "rat", having seen enough, visibly, the pricey equipment of the foreigner, the brand of the equipment, and snitched the skinheads. Thank God, the bandits were in good mood and did not begin to play "moose" as they usually do with beginners, that repeated beatings would not have been endured by our journalist.

But still he reached the Bar empty-handed, and moreover half-naked - he's been removed the military suit, a gift from an american general and memory of such quiet days in Afghanistan. At the Bar the people did not recognize a celebrity. Stalkers are simple lads, not interested in science and nature, not reading smart magazines. They accepted our James as a tourist - such a thing is rare in the Zone, but it happens. He was lodged with the others, got a share not to feel pity for. And our Englishman got accostumed among the local brotherhood.

They advised him to get out of the Zone - but he disagreed. He was engaged in his favorite business: record local tales and the stories of skilled Stalkers. Then a new trouble happened to him: his trigger-happy mercenaries. Them, animals, sometimes practicing their accuracy on us, not to lose that skill. A sniper sits someplace and let's go, that scum, shoots men, that go to the bar from looting. He wounds the first one, that fell behind. He starts yelling, blood everywhere. A friend tries to reach for him to help - the sniper shoots him in the forehead.

When the unfortunate's comrades start to hesitate, not hasting to get under the bullets then the ugly beast begins to shoot the wounded man's fingers or ears... A swine, in a word. And so, our journalist gets to see how lost the mercenary has got. He shoots him in the calves, first right, then left - so that no leg feels wronged. This way, or another - the sniper's bullets stop whistling near temples. The poor fellow already ceased to shout, resigned. Then someone from the "Duty" brought a smoke grenade and under the cover of a smoke screen dragged the poor man from under the firing.

Our hero strongly changed after that - before, he was, all joking, laughing, and now he has become serious, tight-lipped. Some said that after the accident he's been heard a couple times as he cried softly at night. But that's nothing - the foreigner had grown accustomed to a Stalker's life, drank it all up, recognized his grief, and rejoiced. There's one thing he really needed in his heart. In the Zone wounded up some makeshift scribblings: improvised manuscript with stories about life here started to spread around. Some funny, some others - terrible, and others - sad.

Probably, some former student engaged in this deed, one that lived up the first anomalies. But the second our James saw these pieces of paper - he began to shake: it was what he needed! He long made inquiries about that unknown author, all tried to find him. But he disappeared, apparently, that odd fellow - nobody found more of his manuscripts on old yellow pages of Soviet papers. Then James began to ask all Stalkers to bring him these "books" for collection. However, he's a trader now. That's the fate of such history.
Yeah, that's what happens...
